page.title: 09WHAPLODE DROVE-MEMORIES(2)
page.content: INTERVIEWING MRS.F.BEAGLES. Mrs Beagles said that she had lived in the village for 80 years. She said she went to Shiphay Stow school and that she stayed on till she was 13 but you could leave when you were 11.She said that there were 4-5 classes and 70-80 children.She had loved school and had stayed until 13 when she had been allowed to help to teach the young ones.She thought the village had improved over the years. There were no TVs,cars or bikes and 3 shops:Post office,Fishers and Hankins when she was young.She got 1p a week and she bought some jaw pullers and some liquorice. There were no inside toilets and she had to go outside.Another exciting thing was Christmas.You got a penny,an apple, an orange and a little toy.She had a tin bath in front of the fire.
